issue.description: V1rb5 gene missing in build 37
issue.resolution_text: The correct gene, V1rb4, for the reference strain is now correctly annotated at this position in the reference assembly. The new name for V1rb4 is Vmn1r44.

issue.description: There is a possible functional difference in the proteins encoded by RefSeq NM_008264.1 (Hoxa13) and the genomic region to which it aligns.
issue.resolution_text: PCR_C57BL6J_AC015583_1 (FQ828346) confirms the sequence of NM_008264 and AAHY01053339. It has been added to the TPF as a contained component to correct the reference.

issue.description: The anti-sense transcript Copg2as2 (NR_002845.1) is not annotated on the reference genome, while the position of the corresponding Copg2as2 STS (UniSTS:1649110) appears to contradict published reports of the gene's position within the Copg2 promoter.
issue.resolution_text: Gap is being worked on in MG-3512. All further work will be commented on in that ticket.

issue.description: There is a possible functional difference in the proteins encoded by RefSeq NM_001101507.1 (Clec2l) and the genomic region to which it aligns.
issue.resolution_text: PCR_C57BL6J_AC161147_1 (FQ828347) confirmed the sequence of NM_001101507.1. It has been added to the TPF as a contained clone to correct the reference

issue.description: AC116115.11 has a 1-nt insertion compared to nt 1032 of NM_147779.1
issue.resolution_text: PCR_C57BL6J_AC116115_1 was created and added to the tile path as a contained clone to correct the error in the reference.

issue.description: AC102125.13 has a 1-nt deletion compared to NM_130861.2 at nt 1634.
issue.resolution_text: PCR (PCR_C57BL6J_AC102125_1) confirms the sequence of NM_130861.2, and has been added into the TPF as a contained clone to correct the reference

issue.summary: Chr.6: CU207334 acc.ver change disrupts alignments
issue.description: Accession.version update eliminates a previously existing alignment for clone.
issue.resolution_text: This accession is now found to align with and belong in a contig with CU207319, a newly finished clone. Contig order: CU207334 CU207319 CU210926 CU234138

issue.resolution_text: The pcr (PCR_C57BL6J_AC122359_1) confirmed the sequence of AC122359.

issue.description: NM_010646.1 aligns to many Klra family members in the reference genome but it doesn't have its own best hit. It is unclear if this gene is erroneously missing from the reference assembly or validly not present in B6 mice.

issue.status_text: May just be silent in this strain of mice. Will investigate further.
issue.description: It's unclear if Klra14 is erroneously missing from the reference assembly or validly not present in the C57BL/6 genome. PMID 10528196 states: "It is more probable that the Ly49P gene is simply silent, or missing altogether, in certain strains of mice such as B6. The former possibility is supported by the recent characterization of five additional Ly49 genes in B6 mice (3). Although it has only been partially characterized, the intracellular domain of Ly49L is more closely related to Ly49P than either Ly49A or D. The fact that CBA/J mice also appear to have an activating Ly49A-like molecule (as shown by immunoprecipitation studies identical with those done in Fig. 1Go, data not shown) lends support for the theory that Ly49P is, for whatever reason, silenced in B6 mice." [landrum]
issue.resolution_text: na

issue.summary: Possible single nucleotide error in reference component AC131718
issue.description: SNP analysis of the Mouse Genomes Project suggests a possible single nucleotide error in reference clone AC131718
issue.resolution_text: TPF has been updated to show PCR_C57BL6J_AC131718_1 (FQ790389) as a contained accession, correcting the SNP in AC131718

issue.summary: Possible single nucleotide error in reference component AC153624.20
issue.status_text: A PCR was performed. It supported the reference sequence. Awaiting decision on the representation of minor/major alleles in the reference.
issue.description: Possible single nucleotide error in reference component AC153624.20
issue.resolution_text: na

issue.description: Related to genome problem 2004 (JIRA MG-36) for Copg2 which indicates the gap at the 3' end of Copg2 can be filled by CAAA01093966.1 and AC183098.3. However, NR_002845.1 (Copg2as2) which can be aligned on Mm_Celera AC_000028.1 is not aligned to either of these reference sequences so there still appears to be sequence missing in reference between exons 20 ad 21 of Copg2, and there are still large gaps in AC_000028.1
issue.resolution_text: Gap is being worked on in MG-3512. All further work will be commented on in that ticket.
